lead_paragraph: The diverging positions by American and Chinese officials indicated that annual talks had done little to bridge differences.

byline.original: By JANE PERLEZ and CHRIS BUCKLEY

headline.print_headline: U.S. and Beijing Offer Competing Positions on the South China Sea
headline.main: U.S. and Beijing Offer Competing Views on South China Sea

snippet: The diverging positions by American and Chinese officials indicated that annual talks had done little to bridge differences.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry and Chinese counterpart Yang Jiechi express divergent views over China's position in South China Sea, with Yang affirming China's opposition to arbitration case brought by Philippines to assert its claims there; China's refusal to negotiate collectively with Asian nations over rights to sea points to futility of talks between United States and China on issue.
